definitions.definition: to come close together in a group, or to hold your arms and legs close to your body, especially because of cold or fear:
examples: Everyone huddled round the fire to keep warm.

definitions.definition: a small group of people or things that are close together:
examples: A small group of people stood in a huddle at the bus stop.

definitions.definition: to get into a group in order to talk secretly:
examples: The judges went into a huddle to decide the winner.
